abstract: Australia and China signed commercial deals worth more than $8.8 billion on Monday, largely in mining, in another sign that a new Australian mining tax has failed to dampen inward Chinese investment.
snippet: Australia and China signed commercial deals worth more than $8.8 billion on Monday, largely in mining, in another sign that a new Australian mining tax has failed to dampen inward Chinese investment.
lead_paragraph: Australia and China signed commercial deals worth more than $8.8 billion on Monday, largely in mining, in another sign that a new Australian mining tax has failed to dampen inward Chinese investment, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Australia and China Sign Deals Exceeding $8.8 Billion
